title: Drawing, Windblown Pines, Pacific Grove. Verso: Pacific Coast road to Point Sur., April 1898
title_raw: Windblown Pines, Pacific Grove. Verso: Pacific Coast road to Point Sur.
medium: Obverse: graphite and green wash, white guache, on buff paper. Reverse: pencil, pen, and black ink.
inscribed: Obverse: "Wind blown pines/Pacific Grove," Bottom left: caption, locality as copied/ "April 7th 1898." Reverse: in opposite direction, Inscribed "X" and "....(?)"; "pale green." Written Top left:"X....(?) of white /pale green back to......(?)"; bottom, ink over pencil: "Pacific Coast Road to Point Sur/April 8th 1898."Written in Pencil, Bottom right: "Melt (?) from rich brown, at tide to cool black gray into lt cool/gray overlaid with go (/) and creamy buff (?).....(/) mna (/) poppies (/) and red effect/contrast sage green brush.'
description: Horizontal rectangle.  Obverse: "Wind blown pines/ Pacific Grove," five of which are shown.  A hill range is shown in the right background.  Reverse: in opposite direction, top: waves rolling at the rocky coast.  Bottom left vertically: pencil sketch of five trees. Right: Rocky sea shore.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, Windblown Pines, Pacific Grove. Verso: Pacific Coast road to Point Sur., April 1898. Obverse: graphite and green wash, white guache, on buff paper. Reverse: pencil, pen, and black ink.. 
Gift of Mrs. Samuel Colman. 1939-85-9
